Package org.opensextant.giscore.input.kml

Class UrlRef

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.giscore.input.kml.UrlRef
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class UrlRef extends Object implements Serializable
UrlRef manages the encoding/decoding of internally created KML/KMZ URLs to preserve the association between the parent KMZ file and its relative file reference. Handles getting an InputStream to KML linked resources whether its a fully qualified URL or a entry in a KMZ file.

If KmlReader is used to read a KMZ resource then href values for relative URLs will be rewritten as special URIs such that the links can be fetched later using UrlRef to wrap the URI and return InputStream to the resource. A UrlRef is created for each linked resource (e.g. NetworkLink, GroundOverlay, ScreenOverlay, Style with IconStyle, etc.) during reading and an internalized URI is used to reference the resource. If the parent file/URL is a KMZ file and link is a relative URL then the association is preserved otherwise the URL is treated normally.

For example suppose we have a KMZ resource at ... and its root KML document includes a supporting KML file through a relative link kml/include.kml. The URI to this networkLink is returned as kmzhttp://server/test.kmz?file=kml/include.kml. UrlRef strips the "kmz" prefix and the "?file=" suffix from the URI resolving the resource as having a parent URL as ... and a relative link to the file as kml/include.kml.

Use getURI() to get the internal URI and getUrl() to return the original URL.

Includes static validation methods with minor modifications from org.jdom.Verifier: isXMLNameCharacter(), isXMLNameStartCharacter(), etc.

Author:
Jason Mathews

  • Constructor Details

    • UrlRef

      public UrlRef(URL url, String kmzFilePath) throws URISyntaxException
      Convert URL to internalized "kmz" URI with absolute URL of parent KMZ and the kmz file path, which is the relative path to target file inside the KMZ. This allows access to the resources within the KMZ file.
      Parameters:
      url - URL for KML/KMZ resource, never null
      kmzFilePath - relative path within the parent KMZ archive to where the KML, overlay image, model, etc. is located. This is same reference as would be used in HREF element of NetworkLink/Link or GroundOverlay/Icon in KML. Use null if not referring to a sub-element within the KMZ file, which defaults to the root KML file.
      Throws:
      URISyntaxException - if URL has a missing relative file path or fails to construct properly
      NullPointerException - if URL is null

    • UrlRef

      public UrlRef(URI uri) throws MalformedURLException
      Wrap URI with URLRef and decode URI if its an internal kmz reference denoted with a "kmz" prefix to the absolute URI (e.g. kmzfile:/C:/projects/giscore/data/kml/kmz/dir/content.kmz?file=kml/hi.kml). Non-internal kmz URIs will be treated as normal URLs.
      Parameters:
      uri - URI for KML/KMZ resource, never null
      Throws:
      MalformedURLException - If a protocol handler for the URL could not be found, if uri is not absolute, or if some other error occurred while constructing the URL
      NullPointerException - if uri is null

  • Method Details

    • isKmz

      public boolean isKmz()
      Determines if a UrlRef references a linked reference (networked linked KML, image overlay, icon, model, etc.) in a KMZ file.
      Returns:
      true if UrlRef reprensents a linked reference in a KMZ file

    • getInputStream

      public InputStream getInputStream() throws IOException
      Opens a connection to this UrlRef and returns an InputStream for reading from that connection.
      Returns:
      an input stream for reading from the resource represented by the UrlRef.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if referenced link was not found in the parent KMZ resource
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • getInputStream

      public InputStream getInputStream(Proxy proxy) throws IOException
      Opens a connection to this UrlRef and returns an InputStream for reading from that connection.
      Parameters:
      proxy - the Proxy through which this connection will be made. If direct connection is desired, null should be specified.
      Returns:
      an input stream for reading from the resource represented by the UrlRef.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if referenced link was not found in the parent KMZ resource
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • getInputStream

      public static InputStream getInputStream(URL url) throws IOException
      This method gets the correct input stream for a URL. Attempts to determine if URL is a KMZ (compressed KML file) first by the returned content type from the URLConnection and it that fails then by checking if a .kmz extension appears at end of the file name. If stream is for a KMZ file then the stream is advanced until the first KML file is found in the stream.
      Parameters:
      url - The url to the KML or KMZ file
      Returns:
      The InputStream used to read the KML source.
      Throws:
      IOException - when an I/O error prevents a document from being fully parsed.

    • getInputStream

      public static InputStream getInputStream(URL url, Proxy proxy) throws IOException
      This method gets the correct input stream for a URL. Attempts to determine if URL is a KMZ (compressed KML file) first by the returned content type from the URLConnection and it that fails then by checking if a .kmz extension appears at end of the file name. If stream is for a KMZ file then the stream is advanced until the first KML file is found in the stream.
      Parameters:
      url - The url to the KML or KMZ file, never null
      proxy - the Proxy through which this connection will be made. If direct connection is desired, null should be specified.
      Returns:
      The InputStream used to read the KML source.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if a root KML file is not found in the KMZ resource
      IOException - if an I/O error has occurred
      IllegalArgumentException - if content size is <= 0
      NullPointerException - if url is null

    • getURI

      @NotNull public @NotNull URI getURI()
      Returns:
      the internal URI of the UrlRef, never null

    • getURL

      @NotNull public @NotNull URL getURL()
      Returns original external URL. If "normal" URL then URL will be returned same as the URI. If internal "kmz" URI (e.g. kmzhttp://server/test.kmz?file=kml/include.kml) then URL returned is ....
      Returns:
      original external URL, never null

    • getKmzRelPath

      public String getKmzRelPath()
      Gets the relative path to the KMZ resource if UrlRef represents a linked reference (networked linked KML, image overlay, icon, model, etc.) in a KMZ file. For example this would be how the Link href was explicitly defined in a NetworkLink, IconStyle, or GroundOverlay.
      Returns:
      relative path to the KMZ resource otherwise null

      public boolean equals(Object other)

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Normalize and convert internal "URI" form to portable URL form. For example kmzfile:/C:/giscore/data/kml/content.kmz?file=kml/hi.kml is converted into file:/C:/giscore/data/kml/content.kmz/kml/hi.kml. Non-file URIs only strip the kmz prefix and keep file= parameter.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      portable human-readable URL as formatted String

    • isAbsoluteUrl

      public static boolean isAbsoluteUrl(String href)
      Quick test if href is an absolute URL. This means either the string starts with "file:" or matches the regular expression ^[a-zA-Z]+://
      For example, the following match true:
      • ...
      • file:C:/path/test.kml
      • file:/C:/path/test.kml
      Parameters:
      href - URL to test
      Returns:
      true if URL appears to be an absolute URL

    • escapeUri

      public static String escapeUri(String href)
      Escape invalid characters in URI string. Must escape [] and whitespace characters (e.g. ...[level]/r$[y]_c$[x].jpg) which would throw an URISyntaxException if URI is created from this URI string.
      Parameters:
      href - The string to be parsed into a URI
      Returns:
      escaped URI string

    • isIdentifier

      public static boolean isIdentifier(String str)
      Test for relative identifier. True if string matches the set of strings for NCName production in [Namespaces in XML]. Useful to test if target is reference to identifier in KML document (e.g. StyleMap referencing local identifier of a Style).
      Parameters:
      str - the String to check, may be null
      Returns:
      true if string matches an XML identifier reference

    • isIdentifier

      public static boolean isIdentifier(String str, boolean allowWhitespace)
      Test for relative identifier. True if string matches the set of strings for NCName production in [Namespaces in XML]. Useful to test if target is reference to identifier in KML document (e.g. StyleMap referencing local identifier of a Style).
      Parameters:
      str - the String to check, may be null
      allowWhitespace - Flag to allow whitespace in identifier other than first character Whitespace isn't allowed by the spec but often appears in many public KML documents (this is generated and allowed by Google Earth) so allow relaxing the rules.
      Returns:
      true if string matches an XML identifier reference

    • isHexDigit

      public static boolean isHexDigit(char ch)
      Determines if the specified character is a hexadecimal digit [0-9,a-f,A-F].
      Parameters:
      ch - the character to be tested.
      Returns:
      true if the character is a hexadecimal digit; false otherwise.

    • isXMLNameCharacter

      public static boolean isXMLNameCharacter(char c)
      This is a utility function for determining whether a specified character is a name character according to production 4 of the XML 1.0 specification.
      Parameters:
      c - char to check for XML name compliance.
      Returns:
      boolean true if it's a name character, false otherwise.

      Returns:
